newsitem.title: CANADA: Grad & Walker says no statement until Wed..
newsitem.headline: Grad & Walker says no statement until Wed..

text.p: Grad & Walker Energy Corp, whose stock was halted on Monday pending news, would not comment before Toronto Stock Exchange trading resumes on Wednesday, a company spokeswoman said.
The Calgary-based oil company's shares climbed 1.45 to 11.15 before Monday's trading halt midway through the session. Its shares have risen from 9.15 on June 25.
Canadian markets are closed on Tuesday because of the Canada Day holiday.
Grad & Walker's main operating areas include the Marengo and Mantario East oil plays in southwestern Saskatchewan and Three Hills Creek in central Alberta.
Barry Jackson, chief executive of Crestar Energy Inc, which operates in areas close to Grad & Walker's, said Crestar was not in a deal with the company.
Crestar's shares also made a big gain on Monday, climbing 1.25 to 25.10.
Two years ago, the company bought Grad & Walker's southwestern Saskatchewan Mantario oil pool for C$46 million.
"We do not have a deal with Grad & Walker," Jackson said, adding that he fielded several telephone calls on Monday inquiring about the possibility of a takeover.
Another firm rumored to be in a deal with Grad & Walker was Tri Link Resources, although the company does not currently operate in the southwestern Saskatchewan area, analysts said.
Tri Link Chairman Gary Burns was not immediately available for comment.
Tri Link shares were closed unchanged on Monday at 25.75.
Other firms with southwestern Saskatchewan operations near Grad & Walker's include Rigel Energy Corp, Pinnacle Resources Ltd and Stampeder Exploration Ltd. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
